# Winter's Dark Canvas
## Scripture
"And God said, 'Let there be lights in the vault of the sky to separate the day from the night, and let them serve as signs to mark sacred times, and days and years.'" - Genesis 1:14

## Reflection
As we gaze upon the winter night sky, we're met with an inky blackness that can seem overwhelming. Yet, it's against this dark canvas that the stars shine brightest, like diamonds scattered across the velvet expanse. In the same way, our lives can feel shrouded in darkness at times, but it's in these moments that God's light can break through, illuminating our path and guiding us forward. The celestial bodies above us serve as signs, marking the passage of time and reminding us of the sacred rhythms that govern our lives.

## Prayer
Dear Heavenly Father, as we stand beneath the winter sky, we're reminded of the beauty that can emerge from darkness. Help us to trust in your sovereignty, even when our circumstances seem bleak. May the stars above us serve as a reminder of your promise to guide us, and may we find comfort in the knowledge that you are always with us, shining brightly in the darkness. As we navigate the seasons of our lives, may we remain steadfast in our faith, looking to the celestial bodies as signs of your eternal faithfulness. Amen.
